7 Days

7-Day Riviera Maya All-Inclusive Honeymoon

Caribbean Luxury, Cenote Romance & Mayan Magic

The Riviera Maya offers everything honeymooners dream of: turquoise Caribbean waters, adults-only all-inclusive resorts where everything is handled, mystical cenotes for private swims, and ancient Mayan ruins to explore together. This 7-day itinerary balances blissful resort relaxation with just enough adventure to create unforgettable memories.

Trip Highlights

  • Private swim-out suite at adults-only resort
  • Sunrise cenote experience with champagne
  • Couples Mayan spa ritual
  • Private dinner on the beach
  • Tulum ruins at dawn, no crowds
  • Sunset catamaran cruise
Duration
7 Days
Best Time
November to April for ideal weather; May-June for best resort deals
Budget (Mid-Range)
$6,000-9,000 USD per couple

Day-by-Day Itinerary

1

Arrive in Paradise

Riviera Maya Resort

Land at Cancún airport and transfer to your adults-only all-inclusive resort (45-60 minutes). Your honeymoon begins the moment you arrive: champagne welcome, room decorated with rose petals, and the Caribbean stretching before you. Spend the afternoon at your private swim-out pool or on the beach. First sunset as newlyweds on Mexican soil, followed by dinner at the resort's finest restaurant.

Today's Activities:
    {{#each this.activities}}
  • [object Object]
    • 2

    Resort Bliss

    Riviera Maya Resort

    Your first full day: no agenda except each other. Wake up naturally, have breakfast in bed (24-hour room service is your friend), then claim your beach beds. Alternate between pool and ocean as the mood strikes. Book a couples massage at the spa for late afternoon. Watch the sunset from your private balcony, then dress up for the French restaurant. This is honeymoon mode.

    Today's Activities:
      {{#each this.activities}}
    • [object Object]
      • 3

      Private Cenote Experience

      Cenotes & Resort

      Early morning private cenote adventure—your concierge can arrange access to a cenote before public hours. Swim in sacred underground waters as sunlight streams through the jungle canopy, just the two of you. Return to resort for lunch, then afternoon at the spa with traditional Mayan treatments: temazcal ceremony, honey body wrap, and relaxation in the hydrotherapy circuit. Casual dinner at the beach grill.

      Today's Activities:
        {{#each this.activities}}
      • [object Object]
        • 4

        Tulum Ruins at Dawn

        Tulum & Resort

        Leave resort at 7am for Tulum—arrive at 8am opening when it's cool and empty. Walk the clifftop ruins hand-in-hand, overlooking the Caribbean with no crowds. Swim in the turquoise cove below the temples. Continue to Tulum town for brunch at a bohemian café, browse the boutiques on the beach road, then return to your resort for afternoon relaxation. Tonight: the private beach dinner you've been anticipating.

        Today's Activities:
          {{#each this.activities}}
        • [object Object]
          • 5

          Adventure Day

          Riviera Maya

          Choose your adventure together. Option A: Catamaran sailing to Isla Mujeres—snorkel the reef, lunch on the island, sail back at sunset. Option B: Underground river float at Xcaret or Xel-Há parks—a unique shared experience. Option C: Cozumel day trip for world-class diving. Whatever you choose, end the day with dinner at the resort's Mexican restaurant.

          Today's Activities:
            {{#each this.activities}}
          • [object Object]
            • 6

            Playa del Carmen & Final Resort Day

            Playa del Carmen & Resort

            Morning visit to Playa del Carmen's Quinta Avenida—the pedestrian street filled with shops, restaurants, and people-watching. Have lunch at a rooftop restaurant overlooking the beach. Return to your resort by early afternoon for final pool and beach time. This evening: dress your best for the resort's gala dinner, or arrange a special celebration dinner with the chef.

            Today's Activities:
              {{#each this.activities}}
            • [object Object]
              • 7

              Departure

              Cancún Airport

              Final morning in paradise. Watch the sunrise together one last time—walk the beach, swim in your private pool, savor breakfast slowly. Late checkout if available (honeymoons often get this perk). Transfer to Cancún airport full of memories, tanned skin, and plans for your next trip to Mexico.

              Today's Activities:
                {{#each this.activities}}
              • [object Object]
              {{/each}}

Practical Information

Getting There

Fly into Cancún International Airport (CUN). Most resorts offer airport transfers included in honeymoon packages or for ~$100-150 round trip. The Riviera Maya stretches from Cancún south to Tulum—travel time to resort varies from 20 minutes to 2 hours.

Getting Around

You won't need transportation most days—that's the all-inclusive advantage. For excursions, use resort-arranged tours or private drivers. Taxis and Uber work for Playa del Carmen visits.

Frequently Asked Questions

Which all-inclusive resort is best for honeymoons?

For romantic atmosphere: Secrets Maroma Beach has the best beach. For suite quality: Excellence Playa Mujeres with Excellence Club. For value: Dreams Riviera Cancún offers Unlimited-Luxury at lower prices. For ultimate luxury: UNICO 20°87° or Rosewood Mayakoba. All cater beautifully to honeymooners.

Do we need to leave the resort at all?

No—you could spend all 7 days at the resort and have a wonderful honeymoon. The excursions (cenote, Tulum, Playa del Carmen) add variety and memories, but they're optional. Many honeymooners prefer maximum resort time.

Is it better to book through the resort or a travel agent?

Travel agents specializing in honeymoons (especially Virtuoso agents) often get extras: room upgrades, resort credits, special amenities. They also handle any issues. For luxury properties, agent booking almost always adds value. For moderate resorts, direct booking with honeymoon package often works fine.

Should we get travel insurance for our honeymoon?

Absolutely yes. You've just spent significant money on a wedding; protecting your honeymoon investment is wise. Look for policies covering trip cancellation, medical emergencies, and flight delays. Cancel For Any Reason (CFAR) policies offer maximum flexibility.
